content.description: A thought provoking stout face climb up patina crimps and slopers. Climb the lower half past 5 bolts to an optional hand size piece of gear in the horizontal that splits the face, or better yet a small cam just past the small overhang. Pull over the small overlap to increasingly harder moves past 3 more bolts to a bolt anchor located on a boulder at the top of the formation. The route is well bolted but will hold your attention the entire way.
content.location: The furthest right route on Middle God’s, and the first route you pass on the scramble up to Middle God’s.

content.description: Climb the slab past two bolts, through the bulge, and up the vanishing right-facing flake. Pass a third bolt to an anchor (sling).
content.protection: Light rack of small cams and nuts.
content.location: Route starts near the left side of Middle God's Ledge (to the right of the Briar Ledge).

content.description:
Variation on Scared Seamless. 

  Climb past the two bolts on Scared Seamless and up the flake. Before the seam vanishes head right to easier, but run-out, rock.
content.protection: Light rack of small cams and nuts.
content.location: Route starts near the left side of Middle God's Ledge (to the right of the Briar Ledge).

content.description: Continuous offwidth up a right facing corner. Occasional stances to let you catch your breath.
content.protection: Large gear, 4-6", maybe 7".   Can rap off of piton (only one) above Scared Seamless.

climbs.name: Leitmotif
climbs.fa: John Wright, Darell Hensley, Ashton Walton, 1989

content.description: Solo easily up to a right facing flake then slab climb past 2 bolts to the ledge above Scared Seamless. Can use the wall to the right for a little ways until you are forced out entirely on the face with an easy runout above the 2nd bolt. Easiest climb off the Middle God Ledge. If hauling packs, move over above Scared Seamless for less drag.
content.location: To the right of Scared Seamless and to the left of the orange face of Alpenglow. Use a tree for the anchor.

content.description: Light bushwhacking leads to better climbing up the impressive Alpenglow Buttress. Start as if you were going up Leitmotif but then move right under the small overhang past a few pieces of gear until you can reach the horizontal on the Alpenglow Buttress. Move right along the horizontal around the buttress to the line of bolts on the face.  Once established on the face climb the strenuous exposed line past 5 bolts to the top, belay off the small tree.
content.location: Off the Middle God's Ledge on the buttress just right of Leitmotif and left of the Mid-Life Crisis roof.

content.description: A handful of good climbs on level with Oh My God Dihedral, but situated farther east along the Briar Ledge and the Middle God's Ledge.
